name: Lazy.List

types.name: LazyListView
types.comment:
Analogous to `List` type. This is the actual implementation type for the
`LazyList` type. This type is exposed to the user if the user so wishes to
do pattern matching or understand how the list type works. It is not
recommended to work with this type directly. Try working solely with the
provided functions in the package.

values.comment: Alias for `append`. Analogous to `++` for lists.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a

values.comment: Alias for `cons`. Analogous to `::` for lists.

values.name: andMap
values.comment:
Known as `mapN` in some circles. Allows you to apply `map` in cases
where then number of arguments are greater than 5.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList (a -> b) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b

values.name: andThen
values.comment: Chain list producing operations.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> (a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b) -> Lazy.List.LazyList b

values.name: append
values.comment: Append a list to another list.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a

values.name: cons
values.comment: Add a value to the front of a list.

values.name: cycle
values.comment:
Take a list and repeat it ad infinitum. This cycles a finite list
by putting the front after the end of the list. This results in a no-op in
the case of an infinite list.

values.name: drop
values.comment: Drop at most `n` many values from a list.

values.name: dropIf
values.comment: Drop all elements in a list that satisfy the given predicate.

values.name: dropWhile
values.comment: Drop elements from a list as long as the predicate is satisfied.

values.name: empty
values.comment: Create an empty list.

values.name: filterMap
values.comment:
Map a function that may fail over a lazy list, keeping only
the values that were successfully transformed.
values.type: (a -> Maybe.Maybe b) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b

values.name: flatMap
values.comment: Map then flatten.
values.type: (a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b

values.name: flatten
values.comment:
Flatten a list of lists into a single list by appending all the inner
lists into one big list.

values.name: foldl
values.comment: Analogous to `List.foldl`. Is an alias for `reduce`.
values.type: (a -> b -> b) -> b -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> b

values.name: foldr
values.comment: Analogous to `List.foldr`.
values.type: (a -> b -> b) -> b -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> b

values.name: fromArray
values.comment: Convert an array to a lazy list.

values.name: fromList
values.comment: Convert a normal list to a lazy list.

values.name: head
values.comment: Get the head of a list.

values.name: headAndTail
values.comment: Get the head and tail of a list.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Maybe.Maybe ( a, Lazy.List.LazyList a )

values.name: interleave
values.comment:
Interleave the elements of a list in another list. The two lists get
interleaved at the end.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList a

values.name: intersperse
values.comment: Places the given value between all members of the given list.

values.name: isEmpty
values.comment: Detect if a list is empty or not.

values.name: iterate
values.comment:
Create an infinite list of applications of a function on some value.

Equivalent to:

    x ::: f x ::: f (f x) ::: f (f (f x)) ::: ... -- etc...

values.name: keepIf
values.comment: Keep all elements in a list that satisfy the given predicate.

values.name: length
values.comment:
Get the length of a lazy list.

Warning: This will not terminate if the list is infinite.

values.name: map
values.comment: Map a function to a list.

values.name: map2
values.type: (a -> b -> c) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c

values.name: map3
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d

values.name: map4
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList e

values.name: map5
values.type: (a -> b -> c -> d -> e -> f) -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList e -> Lazy.List.LazyList f

values.name: member
values.comment: Test if a value is a member of a list.

values.name: numbers
values.comment:
The infinite list of counting numbers.

i.e.:

    1 ::: 2 ::: 3 ::: 4 ::: 5 ::: ... -- etc...

values.name: product
values.comment: Get the product of a list of numbers.

values.name: product2
values.comment: Create a lazy list containing all possible pairs in the given lazy lists.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b )

values.name: product3
values.comment: Create a lazy list containing all possible triples in the given lazy lists.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c )

values.name: product4
values.comment: Create a lazy list containing all possible 4-tuples in the given lazy lists.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c, d )

values.name: product5
values.comment: Create a lazy list containing all possible 5-tuples in the given lazy lists.
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList e -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c, d, e )

values.name: reduce
values.comment:
Reduce a list with a given reducer and an initial value.

Example :
    reduce (+) 0 (1 ::: 2 ::: 3 ::: 4 ::: empty) == 10
values.type: (a -> b -> b) -> b -> Lazy.List.LazyList a -> b

values.name: repeat
values.comment:
Repeat a value ad infinitum.
Be careful when you use this. The result of this is a truly infinite list.
Do not try calling `reduce` or `toList` on an infinite list as it'll never
finish computing. Make sure you then filter it down to a finite list with `head`
or `take` or something.

values.name: reverse
values.comment: Reverse a list.

values.name: singleton
values.comment: Create a singleton list.

values.name: sum
values.comment: Get the sum of a list of numbers.

values.name: tail
values.comment: Get the tail of a list.

values.name: take
values.comment: Take at most `n` many values from a list.

values.name: takeWhile
values.comment: Take elements from a list as long as the predicate is satisfied.

values.name: toArray
values.comment: Convert a lazy list to an array.

values.name: toList
values.comment: Convert a lazy list to a normal list.

values.name: unique
values.comment: Remove all duplicates from a list and return a list of distinct elements.

values.name: zip
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b )

values.name: zip3
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c )

values.name: zip4
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c, d )

values.name: zip5
values.type: Lazy.List.LazyList a -> Lazy.List.LazyList b -> Lazy.List.LazyList c -> Lazy.List.LazyList d -> Lazy.List.LazyList e -> Lazy.List.LazyList ( a, b, c, d, e )
